main_text.sentence: [5] summarized several normalization methods for cDNA microarray data such as global normalization, dye-swap normalization, block-wise normalization, and scale normalization.
[13] compared a number of normalization methods, including global, linear and LOWESS normalization methods.
[10] presented subset normalization to adjust for location biases combined with global normalization for intensity biases.
[9] suggested iterative normalization of cDNA microarray data to estimate normalization coefficients and to identify control gene set.
[11] proposed an iterative normalization method for cDNA microarray data by estimating a normalization coefficient and identifying control genes.
We compared three different normalization methods: MAS5.0, RMA [14-16] and dChip [17], to evaluate the effect of normalization methods on interspecies reproducibility.
[14] used a mixed model for normalization.
[6] summarized a number of normalization methods for dual labeled microarrays such as global normalization and robust locally weighted scatter plot smoothing (LOWESS, Cleveland [7]).

source_text.title: Evaluation of normalization methods for microarray data
A comparison of normalization methods for high density oligonucleotide array data based on bias and variance
Normalization methods for analysis of microarray gene-expression data
Iterative normalization of cDNA microarray data
Iterative normalization of cDNA microarray data
Model-based analysis of oligonucleotides arrays: Expression index computation and outlier detection
Assessing gene significance from cDNA microarray expression data via mixed models
Robust locally weighted regression and smoothing scatterplots
Normalization for cDNA microarray data: a robust composite method addressing single and multiple slide systematic variation
